page.title: 17REVIVAL: VITICULTURE
page.content: Until recently{viticulture appeared to have disappeared from Britain. 'Tapestry Wines' has two vineyards in Gloucestershire; one is near Cirencester and the other in Apperley,the latter being sold under sold under the label of 'Deerhurst'. The underlying{sandstone}of Apperley, 30 metres above sea level, has led to the production of a wine blended from a French grape, the 'Madelaine Angevine' and 20% from the German 'Reichensteiner'. It is aimed to produce a dry, crispy wine. There are three acres of vines in Apperley and are all hand picked in September. Grapes harvested at Cirencester are transported to the {winery}at Apperley for crushing, fermentation and blending. Providing guided tours the { {vinyard }acts as a tourist attraction.
